definition[0]: determined not to change your mind, even when people think you are being unreasonable
example[1]: I’ve got a very stubborn streak (=a tendency to be stubborn).
example[2]: Paul can be as stubborn as a mule (=very stubborn).
definition[1]: difficult to remove, deal with, or use
definition[2]: refusing to change your mind, even when people think you are wrong or are being unreasonable
example[4]: Dave can be really stubborn once he’s made up his mind.
definition[3]: very stubborn, in way that is annoying and unreasonable
example[6]: I have never met anyone so obstinate.
definition[4]: refusing to change your mind, even when people think that what you want to do is stupid
example[8]: I told her she was making a big mistake but she was too pig-headed to listen.
example[9]: I wish you’d stop being so pig-headed!
definition[5]: very determined to do what you want, often without thinking about the results of your actions – used especially about young people
example[10]: As a girl, she had been lively and headstrong.
definition[6]: doing what you want, even after you have been told to stop, or when you know that it is wrong – used especially about children
example[12]: He was a spoiled and wilful child, who always got his own way.
example[13]: She was passionate and wilful – exactly the sort of creature a man ought to avoid.
definition[7]: behaving in an unreasonable and often angry way, especially by doing the opposite of what people want you to do
example[15]: Teenagers can be ornery and rude.
